results.question: What is the authorized common stock for issuance under the plan?
results.markdown_table_response:
The authorized common stock for issuance under the plan is the number of shares of our common stock authorized for issuance under the Plan multiplied by a grant price per share. The grant price per share is based on the fair value of the shares as of the date of grant.
The fair value of the shares is the price per share on the date of grant, less the (1) number of shares that are excluded from the grant (if any) and (2) a cost of issuance. The cost of issuance is the fair value of the shares as of the date of grant minus the fair value of the shares on the date of grant.
To determine the fair value of the shares as of the date of grant, the shares are converted to their fair value on the date of grant using the fair value on the date of grant and the fair value on the date of grant for each of the following: (1) shares to which the grant is applied, (2) shares not to be granted and (3) shares that are excluded from the grant.
